Ad Text:
18-month max term contract with real ownership and impact
Broad stakeholder exposure across finance and the wider business
Attractive hybrid work model | Energy Discounts | Career Growth Opportunities

Alinta Energy is one of Australia’s biggest energy retailers, generators and developers with over 1.1 million customers. Australia’s energy system is undergoing the biggest transformation in its history and we’re right there with it. We’re investing in and developing large-scale renewables and storage projects as part of our ongoing effort to provide our customers with reliable, affordable and sustainable energy.

We understand that flexibility matters when considering your next role. Let us know your requirements, and we’ll carefully consider how we might accommodate them.

Ready to make a real impact?

Step into a key role within Alinta Energy’s Group FP&A function, where you’ll help shape group level financial insight and executive decision making. Reporting to the FP&A Manager, this role operates at a group wide level, consolidating financial performance, supporting forecasting and budgeting, and producing executive ready reporting. The position is offered as a maximum term contract for 18 months (parental leave cover) and plays an important role in maintaining continuity, accuracy, and confidence in financial reporting within a complex and fast paced environment. This is a highly visible role that combines strong financial governance, analytical depth, and clear financial storytelling.

Why you’ll love working here

At Alinta Energy, we’re taking real action to deliver reliable and sustainable energy for Australia — and that practical approach runs through everything we do. You’ll get clear direction, genuine flexibility, and the support you need to grow, all while working on projects that make a lasting difference. We’re big enough to create impact, but small enough that your ideas and effort will always be seen.

There are plenty of other great benefits of working for Alinta Energy, including flexible working, energy discounts, an Employee Assistance Program (EAP), a paid volunteer day each year, fully stocked kitchens, and lots more.

What you'll do

Deliver group level performance reporting (month-end, rolling forecast, board/executive packs) with clear variance analysis, risks, opportunities, and strong cash flow insights.
Support budgeting and forecasting timetables, partnering with finance teams and business partners to build accurate, forward-looking views.
Enhance financial models and Power BI dashboards, driving automation and consistent reporting in partnership with systems teams.
Respond to ad hoc analysis and executive queries, including owners and government.
Identify and lead process improvements across reporting and analytics to reduce manual effort and lift quality and speed.

Your experience

Proven experience as a Senior Analyst (FP&A/financial analysis) in a large or complex environment, producing executive-level insights.
Strong accounting foundation with a tertiary finance/accounting degree and CA/CPA (or equivalent).
Recent hands on with Oracle EPM (FCCS/PBCS), advanced Excel, and Power BI.
Exceptional written and verbal communication; able to translate complex data into clear narratives for senior stakeholders.
Proactive, analytical, and resilient, with the confidence to challenge assumptions, influence stakeholders, and meet hard deadlines.

Please note this role requires full working rights within Australia.

Like what you’re seeing?

If you like the sound of this, and you’ve got experience in a similar role, we’d love to talk to you. Come and discover better together with Alinta Energy.

We are a 2026 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

If your application progresses, we will need to complete background and pre-employment checks, such as immigration checks, reference checks, criminal background checks, qualification checks, and additional checks for roles related to finance.

Our Diversity Commitment

Alinta Energy offers a truly diverse, safe and supportive work environment. As an equal opportunity employer, Alinta Energy encourages applications from any qualified person, including First Nations Australians, members of the LGBTQIA+ community, people of all ages and people living with a disability. We are also proud to be a WORK180 Endorsed Employer and we are committed to advancing women’s careers.

We look forward to hearing from you.

Click ‘Apply’ to submit your application.
Closing date: 25/02/26

The Senior Manager, Business Intelligence leads the SA Housing Trust's well-established enterprise business intelligence capability, with a strong focus on broader business engagement and overall responsibility for data governance, data warehousing, analytics, insights and geographic information systems (GIS).

The role
Reporting to the Director, Digital and Business Services (CIO), you will contribute directly to the delivery and continuous improvement of the Trust's data and insights capability.
The role exists to ensure that:

Data is governed, secure and of high quality
Insights are timely, accurate and decision-ready
Information services are accessible and fit for purpose
You will set direction, provide leadership and ensure delivery across core business intelligence functions, working closely with executive leaders, directors and senior managers across the Trust.
This role balances strategic leadership with practical delivery.

Key accountabilities
You will:

Develop and lead the Trust's business intelligence vision and strategy
Assist in the further development and adoption of data governance and data quality frameworks
Oversee data warehousing, reporting, analytics and GIS capabilities
Engage senior stakeholders to translate business needs into BI solutions
Drive continuous improvement across BI processes, practices and delivery
About you
You will bring:

Significant experience leading business intelligence or data analytics functions
The ability to operate between strategy, stakeholders and delivery, with strong consulting and engagement skills
Sound people leadership and a passion for leading and delivering continuous improvement
Strong knowledge of data governance, data warehousing and analytics
A practical leadership style suited to complex and regulated environments
A degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Business Technology, BI, or another relevant field will be highly regarded, as will postgraduate qualifications 
Experience in the public sector or similarly regulated organisations will also be well regarded.

About SA Housing Trust
SA Housing Trust is responsible for delivering housing services and programs across South Australia, working with government, community and service partners to support sustainable housing outcomes. The Trust operates across metropolitan and regional locations and manages a large and diverse service portfolio.
    
To find out more, please call Lee Haakmeester from Tasman Human Resource Consulting on (08) 7220 8695 or 0488 067 485.
 
While all applications will be acknowledged, only candidates who have the right to work in Australia, through citizenship or holding an appropriate visa, can be considered. If you are not an Australian citizen, please provide clear evidence of your current visa status in your application.
